intro: Blennodia drumondii, commonly known as the Drummond's blennosperma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the genus Blennosperma. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Blennodia drumondii is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
